summary: After upgrading from v1.11.8 to v1.13.2, OpenTelemetry instrumentation causes excessive CPU usage (up to 100%), which disappears when OTel is disabled. The issue appears related to changes between these versions, possibly involving the reusev8context option or lazy-loaded modules.
userImpact: Users with OpenTelemetry instrumentation enabled experience severe CPU usage spikes (up to 100%) after upgrading to v1.13.x, making production deployments unusable.
rootCause: Likely a lazy-loaded module added in v1.13.2 or interaction between OTel interceptors and reusev8context option, with additional regression in v1.13.2 vs v1.13.1.
proposedFix: Remove the lazy-loaded module added in v1.13.2 or disable reusev8context option as a workaround. Upgrade to v1.14.1 which removed the problematic lazy-loaded module.
workaround: Disable reusev8context option, or downgrade to v1.11.8, or remove OpenTelemetry instrumentation temporarily.
keyQuote: Upon updating from v1.11.8 to v1.13.2, we started to see excessive CPU usage, sometimes up to 100%. Removing all uses of @temporalio/interceptors-opentelemetry resolves the CPU issue.
